intro: Gymnocactus ysabelae var. brevispinus, commonly known as the Ysabel's naked cactus, is a rare and striking member of the Cactaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of Mexico, specifically the state of San Luis Potosí. The plant is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems that are covered in sparse, white spines, giving it a unique and elegant appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, blooming in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
